sentences.sContent: Stone decided to hold a contest to see who could write the best song.
sentences.sCn: 斯通决定举行一场比赛，看谁能够写出最佳歌曲。

sentences.sContent: I only entered the contest for fun.
sentences.sCn: 我只是为了好玩才参加这次比赛的。

sentences.sContent: It is clear that the election will be a close contest .
sentences.sCn: 显然这次选举将是一场难分高下的角逐。

sentences.sContent: ...Annual Chinese speech contest for foreigners was held in Changsha this year...
.... The contest was proved to be a good method of promoting cultural communication between China and other parts of the world...

phrases.pCn: 无赛事；无竞争；不抗辩；无争议
势均力敌的竞争(指竞选等)

remMethod.val: con ＋ test(测试) → 测验 → 竞赛

trans.tranOther: a competition or a situation in which two or more people or groups are competing with each other
